white.name: White
white.description: White represents order, peace, and structure. It values law, honour, and the greater good over individual desires.
white.philosophy: White believes in creating a perfect world through order and organisation. It seeks to eliminate conflict through laws and moral codes.

blue.name: Blue
blue.description: Blue represents knowledge, logic, and manipulation. It values intellect, technology, and the pursuit of perfection through understanding.
blue.philosophy: Blue believes that anything can be improved through knowledge and careful study. It seeks to control through information and preparation.

black.name: Black
black.description: Black represents power, ambition, and self-interest. It values individual achievement and is willing to pay any price for power.
black.philosophy: Black believes that power is the only thing that matters and that everyone should look out for themselves first.

red.name: Red
red.description: Red represents emotion, freedom, and impulse. It values passion, chaos, and acting on instinct rather than careful planning.
red.philosophy: Red believes in following your heart and living life to the fullest, even if it means taking risks.

green.name: Green
green.description: Green represents nature, growth, and instinct. It values the natural order and believes in accepting what you are rather than trying to change.
green.philosophy: Green believes that nature knows best and that trying to improve on natural systems only leads to problems.

colourless.name: Colourless
colourless.description: In Magic: The Gathering, colourless has two in-game meanings. It is either a type of object or a type of mana. Note that colourless is not a colour, and is not represented in the colour wheel.
colourless.philosophy: Colourless represents artifice, universal solutions, and mechanical efficiency. It transcends the limitations and philosophies of the five colours, offering neutral tools and effects that any deck can utilise.
